publications.title: Two modes of midfrontal theta suggest a role in conflict and error processing
publications.abstract: Midfrontal theta increases during scenarios when conflicts are successfully resolved. Often considered a generic signal of cognitive control, its temporal nature has hardly been investigated. Using advanced spatiotemporal techniques, we uncover that midfrontal theta occurs as a transient oscillation or 'event' at single trials with their timing reflecting computationally distinct modes.

publications.title: Transient oscillations as computations for cognition: Analysis, modeling and function
publications.abstract: We review recent evidence suggesting that transient oscillations, or bursts, are fundamental units of cognitive computation. We discuss methods for their detection and analysis, and how they can be modeled.

publications.title: Failing to attend versus failing to stop: Single-trial decomposition of action-stopping in the stop signal task
publications.abstract: Action-stopping is a critical executive function. We used a single-trial decomposition of behavior in the stop signal task to distinguish between failures of attention and failures of inhibition.

publications.title: Transient beta modulates decision thresholds during human action-stopping
publications.abstract: Action-stopping in humans involves bursts of beta oscillations in prefrontal-basal ganglia regions. To determine the functional role of these beta bursts we took advantage of the Race Model framework describing action-stopping.

publications.title: Motor cortex oscillates at its intrinsic post-movement beta rhythm following real (but not sham) single pulse, rhythmic and arrhythmic transcranial magnetic stimulation
publications.abstract: We aimed to test the idea that rhythmic transcranial magnetic stimulation (TMS) entrains cortical oscillations. We examined oscillatory responses in the electroencephalogram (EEG) to TMS over primary motor cortex.

publications.title: Does action-stopping involve separate pause and cancel processes? A view from premotor cortex
publications.abstract: Commentary on the mechanisms of action-stopping, discussing whether it involves distinct pause and cancel processes based on evidence from the premotor cortex.

publications.title: Behavioral induction of a high beta state in sensorimotor cortex leads to movement slowing
publications.abstract: We show that a movement instruction generates a high beta state (post movement beta rebound) which then slows down subsequent movements required during that state.

publications.title: Temporally-precise disruption of prefrontal cortex informed by the timing of beta bursts impairs human action-stopping
publications.abstract: Human action-stopping is thought to rely on a prefronto-basal ganglia-thalamocortical network. We used fMRI-guided TMS to disrupt right inferior frontal cortex at the time of beta bursts, impairing stopping performance.

publications.title: Temporal cascade of frontal, motor and muscle processes underlying human action-stopping
publications.abstract: We show that, following the requirement to stop, there was an increase of right frontal beta at ~120 ms, followed by broad skeletomotor suppression at ~140 ms.

publications.title: Preparing to stop action increases beta band power in contralateral sensorimotor cortex
publications.abstract: We used scalp EEG to test the hypothesis that people prepare to stop by putting parts of their motor system into a suppressed state ahead of time, reflected by increased beta band power.

publications.title: A Cortico-Basal Ganglia Model for choosing an optimal rehabilitation strategy in Hemiparetic Stroke
publications.abstract: We propose a cortico-basal ganglia model capable of performing reaching tasks under normal and stroke conditions to facilitate the selection of optimal therapy.

publications.title: Modeling the effect of environmental geometries on grid cell representations
publications.abstract: We modeled how environmental geometries influence the firing fields of grid cells, providing insights into spatial navigation mechanisms.

publications.title: A unified hierarchical oscillatory network model of head direction cells, spatially periodic cells, and place cells
publications.abstract: We present a unified oscillatory network model that explains the generation of head direction cells, grid cells, and place cells in a hierarchical manner.

publications.title: An oscillatory neural autoencoder based on frequency modulation and multiplexing
publications.abstract: We propose an oscillatory neural network model that performs the function of an autoencoder, utilizing frequency modulation and multiplexing.

publications.title: A Neurocomputational Model of the Effect of Cognitive Load on Freezing of Gait in Parkinson's Disease
publications.abstract: We present a neurocomputational model explaining how cognitive load can exacerbate freezing of gait in Parkinson's disease patients.

publications.title: A model of multisensory integration and its influence on hippocampal spatial cell responses
publications.journal: IEEE Transactions on Cognitive and Developmental Systems
publications.abstract: This study models how multisensory information is integrated and influences the responses of spatial cells in the hippocampus.

publications.title: A biologically plausible architecture of the striatum to solve context-dependent reinforcement learning tasks
publications.abstract: We propose a striatal architecture model that solves context-dependent reinforcement learning tasks, highlighting the role of cholinergic interneurons.

publications.title: A computational model of altered gait patterns in Parkinson's disease patients negotiating narrow doorways
publications.abstract: We simulated gait changes in Parkinson's disease patients using a computational model of the Basal Ganglia based on Reinforcement Learning.
